item.content:encoded:
Privacy

This article answers privacy related questions about the Music Uncovered app.

Main data processing in Music Uncovered

Music Uncovered purpose is to listen to music and identify the songs. For this purpose the app uses your microphone to access the input audio stream. As an alternative audio source it can also access the audio stream send to your Apple AirPods. In both cases the audiostream is converted into a signature. The signature is a compressed version of the audio stream but it cannot be converted back to the audiostream. The signature can be compared to the known signature of music titles. For that purpose the signature is transferred to the Shazam servers. They try to match your signature with the signature of all the songs in there database. If they find a match, they respond with the song information which includes title, artist, album, release year and the URL of the related coverart. The app then loads the cover art from the URL if available and displays information of the matched song.

item.title: About
item.content:encoded:
About

All about Music Uncovered

Music Uncovered is an app that listen to music around you and presents cover and song information in a fullscreen view which is updated automatically with each new song. It uses matching colors and a beautiful layout to implement a glancable song display which can be read even from some distance. For each recognized song it presents title, artist, album, release year and cover art if available.

As a user of Music Uncovered you can decide if you want to identify the music just once or nonstop. The idea behind the nonstop mode is to have the app running for example in a corner of your table and whenever you want to know which song is currently playing, just glance to the app screen and instantly see all infos about the song without the need for further interaction.
